column2: The Vandalic Order

The Order of Brothers of the House of Saint Geisericus has been formed, sponsored by the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church and the Gothic nobility. The Vandalic Order, much like other knightly orders, primarily protect and care for pilgrims, but will serve any [Root.Religion.GetName] ruler willing to pay for their upkeep. Being a religious order, they will only fight against heretics and infidels.
Several Kingdoms in Europe are fighting to keep the pagans back and try to spread Christianity eastwards. The Vandalic Order should assist them by offering to settle on their borders.
I will send an offer

To the Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nYour wisdom and mercy are legendary. The Vandalic Order wishes to assist you in your valiant struggle against the pagans. By transfering a border County to the order, we will be able to establish a local presence and fight these heathens.
An intriguing idea, but not at this time...
column3: Bonne idée, mais pas tout de suite...
column4: Eine faszinierende Idee, aber nicht dieses Mal ...
column6: Una idea interesante, pero no en este momento...

column2: [From.GetTitledName] has graciously seceded the [Root.County.GetFullName] to us. The Teutonic Order will now be able to effectively fight the heathens in this region.
column3: [From.GetTitledName] nous a gracieusement cédé le(la) [Root.County.GetFullName]. L’ordre Teutonique va maintenant pouvoir combattre efficacement les païens dans cette région.
column4: [From.GetTitledName] hat uns gnädigerweise die Grafschaft [Root.County.GetFullName] abgetreten. Jetzt kann der Deutsche Orden die Heiden dieser Region effizient bekämpfen.
column6: [From.GetTitledName] nos ha cedido cortésmente el [Root.County.GetFullName]. Ahora la Orden Teutónica podrá combatir con eficacia a los paganos de esta región.

column2: The Vandalic Order

In an effort to defend [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] against pagan attacks, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has granted the Vandalic Order the [From.County.GetFullName]. This province has never been fully settled and many of the population are still heathens. This noble gesture could help protect the endangered frontier of [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as well as further the Holy War against pagans.

Holy Order or not, I will not let any foreign power establish a hold in my realm.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Ordre sacré ou pas, je ne laisserai aucune puissance étrangère avoir la mainmise sur mon Royaume.

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]
column4:
Glaubensorden oder nicht - ich werde keiner ausländischen Macht gestatten, in meinem Reich einen Stützpunkt zu etablieren.

Gezeichnet,
[From.GetTitledName]
column6:
Orden Sagrada o no, no dejaré que ninguna potencia extranjera se establezca en mi reino.

Firmado,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: Outrageous!

Under Romantic influence, the Gothic people in the province of [Root.GetName] have adopted new speech and new customs, becoming neither quite Latin nor Gothic in culture, but instead becoming something called 'Gautés' in their own vulgar tongue.
Gautés, I see...
Found the Holy Western Empire
Is it not every [Root.GetTitle]'s dream to be recognized as the true successor to the Caesars? I can invoke the translatio imperii and be hailed as ruler of a new Roman Empire in the west!
Controls Roma itself, the Duchy of Latium, or is [Root.GetKingQueen] of Romania or [Root.GetEmperorEmpress] of Italia\n
Holds at least one kingdom or empire title within the de jure empires of Gallia, Germania, Africa or Britannia\n
No other Christian ruler is Emperor of Italia, Gallia, Germania, Africa or Britannia\n

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Norse culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Geatish.
column3: Le peuple de [Root.GetName] a développé sa langue et ses coutumes à un point tel qu'il est maintenant considéré comme une branche distincte de la culture nordique. Ses gens ont commencé à se définir en tant que Geatois.
column4: Die Menschen von [Root.GetName] haben ihre Kultur und Sprache soweit entwickelt, dass sie nun als eigener Zweig der nordischen Kultur betrachtet werden können. Sie haben begonnen, sich selbst als Gauten zu bezeichnen.
column6: Los habitantes de [Root.GetName] han desarrollado su idioma y sus costumbres hasta el punto en que ahora pueden ser considerados parte de una rama distinta de la cultura Nórdica. Han comenzado a referirse a sí mismos como Gautas.

column2: What will they think of next, I wonder.
column3: Je me demande quelle sera leur prochaine lubie.
column4: Ich frage mich, was sie sich wohl als Nächstes überlegen werden.
column6: Me pregunto qué será lo siguiente.

column2: Welcome into the fold, my Geatish brothers and sisters.
column3: Bienvenue au bercail, mes frères et sœurs geatois.
column4: Willkommen im Schoß der Familie, meine gautischen Brüder und Schwestern.
column6: Bienvenidos al redil, mis hermanos y hermanas Gautas.

column2: Stonehenge

You have captured the great pagan site at Stonehenge, one of the most mystic places of Celtic paganism. Here stands the great stones of... er, Stonehenge, which is said to have an immense importance in the heathen faith of the Britons. Stonehenge's exact role isn't fully understood by us, but what's important is that it serves as a focal point for the British pagans, from which they appear to draw much moral strength and inspiration.
Tear it down!
Keep it and build a grand Christian church on the site.
column3: Conservez-le et construisez une grande église chrétienne sur ce site.
column4: Erhaltet sie und errichtet eine prächtige Kirche an dieser Stätte.
column6: Mantenerlo y construir una magnífica iglesia cristiana junto a él.

column2: Leave these devil-stones well alone.
Stonehenge destroyed

As the bitter war in Britain rages on, the armies of [From.GetTitledName] have captured Stonehenge, the site of a great heathen shrine. By order of the conquering [From.GetTitle], the troops tore down the pagan stones and then proceeded to destroy the entire shrine. This has enfuriated people of the Celtic religion everywhere.
Stonehenge! We will have our revenge!
A foul sacrilege!
Gloria in excelsis Deo!
